p: The rapid occurrence of climate change has caused disturbances in crops, such as a rise in disease mortality, the emergence of new pests, increased greenhouse gas (GHG) emission, which requires rapid actions in farming management [ 69, 70]. To combat these effects of climate change, mitigation and adaptation strategies are primary instruments to implement. These measures are managed distinctly, due to differences in priorities for the measures and segregated planning and implementation policies at international and national levels [ 70, 71].
